input_text:
Job Title: Supply Chain Associate Manager – Staffing COE

Location: Plano, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Overview

Location Free Role - Prefer candidate that resides in the southwest region.

This person will support the Manufacturing Plants, Warehouses, and Service Operations (SOPS) locations in the Southwest Region with staffing needs to become “Staffed, Stable and Capable”. The role will serve as a direct link to the field regarding headcount and staffing which will include headcount tracking, analysis, and retention improvements. The position will fall underneath the Staffing Center of Excellence team.

Responsibilities

Provide hiring and retention tactics to meet staffing Employer of Choice (EOC), turnover, OT and FTU targets for assigned locations in the Southwest region.Work with field contacts to develop the desired End-To-End Employee Experience focusing on our COE workstreams of “Staffed, Stable, Capable”.Primary point of contact for assigned Region’s MFG, WH & SOPS locations to escalate staffing needs or emergency staffing coverage.Consistent communications for field support, including site visits to support Staffing Points and partnering with Region Performance Managers and FL-Select HR team to reach Staffing KPIs/goals.Support Regional and Site Staffing venues. (i.e. Deep Dives, Site Staffing meetings, Vertical Team calls/meetings)Help the sites optimize work schedules be leveraging the Predictive Staffing Model.Support the implementation of WAVE conversations and the deployment of No Forced Overtime for assigned locations in the Southwest region.Communicate updates / answer questions and ensure EOC changes are updated on One Stop Shop for designated region.Manage staffing algorithm process to help the field effectively determine staffing headcount requirements.Facilitate / Collaborate National Staffing Calls with Staffing Points, HRBP’s and Senior Leadership.Manage third-party labor (3PL) relationships to support field staffing gaps and expedite staffing efforts (Pontoon, A1QLS, Launch).Support field headcount tracking to include reporting, insights, and analysis.Support the field locations in minimizing Temporary EE utilization for assigned locations.Participate on staffing cadence.% Travel: 20%-30%

Compensation And Benefits

The expected compensation range for this position is between $85,200 - $142,650 based on a full-time schedule.Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary.Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 10% of annual salary paid out annually.Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement.In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s DegreeIn depth knowledge of manufacturing operationsProven collaborative, leadership, and influencing capabilities.Practical knowledge of Office suite of toolsStrong organizational and analytical abilitySelf-starter with attention to detail; Ability to identify business issues and generate solutions.Ability to interact with diverse organizations at all levels, including Senior ExecutivesSolid verbal and written communication and presentation skillsAbility to manage multiple competing priorities.Strong change management and project management skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Operations Management or BusinessField operations leadership with 3+ years’ experienceStrong project management skillsIn depth knowledge of field staffing processes and tools

EEO Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity

If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy.

Please view our Pay Transparency Statement

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
